article.class: post hentry page post-2208663 type-page status-publish

h5.span: On Friday, April 17, the Juniata County School District will begin honoring the Class of 2020 and supporting the nurses, doctors, and first responders on the front line of COVID-19 by lighting up our high school stadium at 8:20 pm (2020 hours).
Schools from our area and across our nation are taking part in the “Be the Light” Campaign.
Each Friday at 8:20 pm through the end of May (graduation), our scoreboards will display the score as 20-20 in honor of this year’s graduating class.

Please note that supporting residents are NOT permitted on stadium grounds during this time and should remain at home. If people are compelled to support this initiative from their homes, get your favorite noisemaker (cowbells, horns, etc.) or rally towel, poms, etc. and take a selfie picture or video, post it to your social media site and tag on Twitter @JCSDAthletics, @EastJuniata, @JuniataHS or on Facebook “JCSDAthletics”, “East Juniata Junior/Senior High School”, “Juniata County School District”
We cannot stress this enough, supporters of this initiative should NOT travel onto school district property. Thank you!

span.strong:
JCSD SCHOOL YEAR INFORMATION —
Updated 4/9/20 — 7:30 PM

h5.span: Governor Wolf announced today that Pennsylvania schools will remain closed for the remainder of the academic year. We were certainly hoping the schools would be able to reopen this year, but with this announcement, we must prepare to move forward. This means your teachers will continue to provide review and enrichment activities through virtual and other formats as we finish this year’s school calendar. Again we ask that if you are having difficulties receiving your assignments, please contact your school office.

strong.span:
CONTINUITY OF EDUCATION PLAN SUBMISSION —
Updated April 6, 2020

h5.span: JCSD Community,

Starting on April 8th and running through April 14th, the district will have student work drop off spots available at Juniata Elementary School and East Juniata Elementary School for those students using materials that were mailed to their residence and unable to take advantage of virtual options. From 7:00 am to 7:00 pm the first set of entrance doors to the school buildings listed above will be open and have drop boxes available in the vestibule area. The drop boxes will be labeled with the name of each school. Please place your materials in the box that is labeled with your child’s school. The drop boxes at East Juniata Elementary School will be for students attending East Juniata Elementary School and East Juniata High School. The drop boxes at Juniata Elementary School will be for students attending Juniata Elementary School, Tuscarora Junior High School and Juniata High School. If you are unable to drop off your child’s materials, please get in contact with your home school for further information.
If you received materials by mail, a new packet of materials will be released shortly after the 14th for your child to continue with their studies. If you are having difficulty receiving materials or have not received any to this point, please get in contact with your child’s school. If there is no answer, please leave a message and someone will get back in contact with you as soon as possible. We would like to thank all of our parents and students for their continued hard work during this unprecedented closing of our schools.
Stay Safe and Healthy
JCSD Administration
JCSD Community,

As we continue to offer educational programming virtually, we have tried to minimize possible problems but some are sure to come up. With this in mind, we have put together several documents to help you navigate these issues to the best of your ability and provide guidance should the problem require intervention from our IT staff. Attached to this email are six documents covering an assortment of questions. Please look through each and familiarize yourself with the information available so you will be able to refer to the appropriate help section if needed. The documents provide information covering basic troubleshooting and setup, cleaning and care, locations for drive through download, and several with information should you need additional help from our IT staff. Some of the information provided may change or update as we move forward so please continue to monitor your email for further information when it becomes available. These documents will also be made available on our website.

Please remember, we are in this unprecedented situation together and help is available should the need arise. Please stay in regular contact with your teachers. They can help guide you through any school issue you are having. In addition, our administrative staff are available to help as well. Please contact your local school office if needed.
Stay Safe and Healthy
Gary Dawson, Superintendent

strong.span: Please click on this link — https://www.theacademy.net/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Academy-Parent-Letter.pdf — if you are a student attending “The Academy” in Mifflin County. Thank you!

Good evening JCSD students and families,
Linked below you will find information that will help you to better understand the process for schooling starting tomorrow. As you know, this is completely new for everyone and the process may change over the next few days and weeks. If you have any questions, please reach out to your teachers, principals or guidance counselors. Stay healthy!
Christie Holderman, Assistant Superintendent, Juniata County School District

JCSD COVID-19-FAPE
Continuity of Education Plan – Family Letter

span.a: JCSD Remote Learning Guidance for Families

a.span: DIGITAL LEARNING LETTER FROM DR. DAWSON

strong.span: Beginning Monday, March 30 enrichment materials will be available for students on their digital learning platforms. Students are encouraged to begin checking their emails for news regarding these assignments. If you have trouble receiving these materials, please reach out to your child’s school directly and leave a message with your child’s name and grade.

h5.span:
In this climate of uncertainty, even though the U.S. Census Bureau is on an operational pause, we are still hiring for the 2020 Census. The positions are temporary with varying pay ranges. For Census takers in Juniata County the pay starts at $14.00 per hour.At this time we are looking towards sometime in May as a starting point. However, we are continuing to offer these jobs at this time,so applicants are still being accepted right now.
If you could post this on your site that if anyone that is furloughed right now can apply at 2020census.gov/jobs, Then fill out the application. And if they have any questions they can call 1-855-562-2020 then choose option 1.If you need we can send you flyers by FedEx to hand out to the students that come for the free meals.
Thank You for your time and support.

Juniata County School District elementary school principals are requesting parents of children who will be enrolled in school for the first time this fall to register their children for school by contacting Polly Digon at the district’s administrative office at 146 Weatherby Way, Mifflintown; via email at pdigon@jcsdk12.org; or by calling 717-436-2111, ext. 5002.

br.span: Kindergarten registration is open to any child who will be five years of age on or before September 1, 2020. To be eligible for first grade, a child must be six years of age on or before September 1, 2020. If parents do not feel their child is ready for kindergarten, they may elect to wait until the following year to register.

It is important that parents review the immunization status of their child, since children entering school for the first time are required to be immunized as follows: four doses of diphtheria and tetanus vaccine, with one dose administered on or after the child’s fourth birthday; four doses of polio vaccine, with one dose administered on or after the child’s fourth birthday; three doses of hepatitis B; two doses each of measles, mumps and rubella (MMR) vaccine; and two doses of varicella (chickenpox) vaccine or history of disease.

If all immunizations have not been completed, parents should contact their family doctor or clinic to have them completed. Children may be exempt from immunization requirements for medical, religious or strong philosophical objections.

span.strong: ALL new student registrations can be completed at our District Office located at 146 Weatherby Way, Mifflintown, PA 17059 with Mrs. Polly Digon.

span.span: The Grace Period ended on 10/07/19 for carry over status from 2018-2019 school year. If you did not do a new application, you need to do one online at

span.strong: El Período de Gracia terminó el 10/07/19 para el estatus de prórroga del año escolar 2018-2019. Si no hizo una nueva solicitud, debe hacer una en línea en

h5.span: In addition, you can keep track of how much money is in your child’s meal account, as well as add money to the account by going to
or by downloading the MySchoolBucks App for free from Google Play or the App Store.
If you need assistance with either of these websites or creating accounts, please contact Kathy Gilson, Food Services Director, at (717)-436-2111, x5015.

a.strong: Juniata County SD District Plan Acceptance Notification

h5.em: To help improve information sharing about game changes, we are informing parents/players/fans of our Big Teams websites and the feature to sign up for alerts.

li.h5: Go to either www.ejhstigers.com OR www.jhsindians.com
In the upper right hand corner click REGISTER
Once you register an account your fan dashboard will come up. Click on MY FAVORITES/ALERTS
Add a SCHOOL (Search for East Juniata or Juniata or both!)
Then add the TEAM or TEAMS you would like to get notifications about.
Next, click ALERTS and choose SCHEDULE CHANGES for each sport you would like to get notifications about. (We do not use this system to report scores.)
Finally, click ALERT SETTINGS. Enter your email or cell phone number. You will get a confirmation alert.

p.em: As soon as an event is postponed or cancelled, you will receive a notification. This is for games only, not practices. Changes in practice should come from coaches.

strong.a: Juniata County School District Comprehensive Plan

em.span: The Juniata County School District is an equal opportunity institution and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in the treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations, including its employment practices, as required by Title VI, Title IX and Section 504. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district’s activities and programs. The Juniata County School District offers CTE programs in agriculture, health professions, building trades and CADD. For information regarding civil rights or grievance procedures, contact Travis Quici (Title IX Coordinator) at Juniata High School, 3931 William Penn Highway, Mifflintown, PA 17059; telephone (717) 436-2193; Ben Fausey (Section 504 Coordinator) at Juniata High School, 3931 William Penn Highway, Mifflintown, PA 17059; telephone: (717) 436-2193; Wendy L. Jerrehian (Section 504 Coordinator) at East Juniata High School, 32944 Route 35, McAlisterville, PA 17049; telephone: (717) 463-2111; or Andy Kinzer (504 Coordinator) at Tuscarora Junior High School, 3873 William Penn Highway, Mifflintown, PA 17059; phone 717-436-2165.

El distrito escolar del Condado de Juniata es una institución de igualdad de oportunidades y no discriminará sobre la base de raza, color, origen nacional, sexo, edad o incapacidad en la admisión a sus programas, servicios, o actividades, en el acceso a ellos, en el tratamiento de individuos, o en cualquier aspecto de sus operaciones, incluyendo sus prácticas de empleo, según lo requerido por título VI, Título IX y sección 504. La falta de destrezas en el idioma inglés no será un obstáculo para la admisión o participación en las actividades y programas del distrito. El distrito escolar del Condado de Juniata ofrece programas de CTE en agricultura, profesiones de salud, oficios de construcción y CADD. Para información sobre derechos civiles o procedimientos de quejas, comuníquese con Travis Quici (Coordinador del Título IX) en la escuela secundaria Juniata, 3931 William Penn Highway, Mifflintown, PA 17059; teléfono (717) 436-2193; Ben Fausey (Coordinadora de la sección 504) en la escuela secundaria Juniata, 3931 William Penn Highway, Mifflintown, PA 17059; teléfono: (717) 436-2193; Wendy L. Jerrehian (Coordinadora de la sección 504) en la escuela secundaria East Juniata, 32944 Route 35, McAlisterville, PA 17049; teléfono: (717) 463-2111; o Andy Kinzer (504 coordinadora) en la escuela secundaria junior Tuscarora, 3873 William Penn Highway, Mifflintown, PA 17059; teléfono 717-436-2165.
